instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.820-3584: What is 820-3584? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 820 3536, Not charging with original charger
threads.message:
Hey, 

this one is the second time it comes back!!!

First time the problem was <CAPACITOR>C7376</CAPACITOR> shorted i replace the capacitor and realize the machine only work's with my fake charger! I replace the <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> 2 times no changes, only works after to replace <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR>. 

After 2 weeks this one comes back with same problem! 

It has happened to me many times, i repair many machines with a shorted cap or some times corrosion on simple component and after repair the main problem next the machine don't charge with a fake charge! 

This one is giving me a headache!

threads.title: 820 3536, Not charging with original charger
threads.message:
"820 3536, Not charging with original charger
-------------------------------
the machine don't charge with a fake charge!"
More clearly possible???

Do you get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3V42 with original charger?
What about with fake one, or bench power supply?
Did you check <DIODE>D7012</DIODE>?

threads.title: 820 3536, Not charging with original charger
threads.message:
I'm sorry for my mistake! i want to say original charger on "the machine don't charge with a fake charge!"! 

But on this moment for me complicated more because i disassembly the macbook and the motherboard start to work with original charger!! 

I did not want to send it back to the client and 1 week later comes again! this is inconstant! do you have any advice so do not come back to it ?? thanks

threads.title: 820 3536, Not charging with original charger
threads.message:
Okay, to avoid mistakes: 

Original Charger - without battery plugged the machines start well 
                           - with battery plugged i don't have green light and machines don't work 


Fake charger -  with/without battery plugged the machines start well but don't charge the battery 

i can see 4% on battery i think it's not a battery problem.

threads.title: 820 3536, Not charging with original charger
threads.message:
The machine starts on battery only?

Connect both charger and battery.
Then post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltage pins 9 & 15.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: 820 3536, Not charging with original charger
threads.message:
I was wrong again! I forgot that I can only see if it is charging when I enter to the OSX! Small change: 

Fake charger - with/without battery plugged the machines start well [SIZE=14px][B]and [/B][/SIZE]charge the battery

threads.title: 820 3536, Not charging with original charger
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltage pins 9 & 15 - 0V & 0.066V

resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28  - 6.3ohm & 23.6ohm 

already tried to do reset SMC with BATTERY and Charger and the machine start but don't have green_ light! only assume battery! 

i don't know if help but i remember when it comes for the first time i needed to replace  DC-IN (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3584</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) for another one! 

tha nks

threads.title: 820 3536, Not charging with original charger
threads.message:
MLB should start without LIO flrx connected, just the 5 pins DC cable required.
Post voltages for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> with original charger only; 2, 3, 12, 13, 14, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: 820 3536, Not charging with original charger
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> 

pin2 - 16.63V
pin3 - 4.09V
pin12 - 3.4V
pin13 - 3.4V
pin14 - 3.4V
pin17 - 12.61V
pin19 - 5.5V
pin20 - 5.5V
pin27 - 17V

threads.title: 820 3536, Not charging with original charger
threads.message: on this i replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and now it's charging! i'm with a little afraid to send this to the client and come back again!

threads.title: 820 3536, Not charging with original charger
threads.message: Resistance between pins 17/18 is high should be around 2.2 ohms. Is it now after new ISL?
